meanings.definition: To change the course of a sailing vessel by hauling on the weather braces and backing the jibs.
meanings.sent1: The sailors were boxhauling to steer the ship in a new direction.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the captain decided to boxhaul to avoid the rough waves.
meanings.sent3: As the crew started boxhauling, the seagulls above seemed confused by the sudden turn.
meanings.sent4: The decision to boxhaul the ship brought a sense of control amidst the chaos of the storm.
meanings.sent5: With determination, they began boxhauling, each pull bringing them closer to safety.

meanings.definition: A method of changing the course of a sailing vessel by hauling on the weather braces and backing the jibs.
meanings.sent1: The captain explained the process of boxhauling to the new sailors.
meanings.sent2: The old map showed the technique of boxhauling used by sailors centuries ago.
meanings.sent3: The boxhauling equipment was neatly stored on the deck, ready for use if needed.
meanings.sent4: In the painting, the sailors were engaged in boxhauling under a dramatic sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind filled the sails as they prepared for boxhauling.
